newsitem.title: UK: UK's Comino sets date for AIM flotation, eyes buys.
newsitem.headline: UK's Comino sets date for AIM flotation, eyes buys.

text.p: Software application specialist Comino Plc said on Thursday it plans to float on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market (AIM) on April 24.
The company said it is raising 1.53 million stg to fund strategic acquisitions. The placing price of the shares is 130p, valuing the company at 14.35 million stg.

Comino is the holding company of three specialist computer software companies supplying computerised solutions to housing associations in the UK, to the fashion and clothing industry and the pension funds sector.

Group chief executive Garth Selvey said the company is looking at a number of possible acquisitions and highlighted the fashion and clothing industry as area where Comino could make a significant impact.

"If we could double our size in the fashion and clothing sector, it would quadruple our presence," said Selvey. "I don't mean quadrupling profits but the effect would be a lot greater than the sum of the parts and hopefully would be profit enhancing."
Comino estimates it will make a pre-tax profit to March 31 1997 of 1.324 million stg.
One fund manager said the 130p placing price looked cheap. "The point to labour is that at about 12.5 times earnings, the price is not exactly onerous for this type of company," he said.
